1.text: The book of the origins of Jesus Christ, the son of David, the son of Abraham.

2.text: Abraham became the father of Isaac. Isaac became the father of Jacob. Jacob became the father of Judah and his brothers.

3.text: Judah became the father of Perez and Zerah by Tamar. Perez became the father of Hezron. Hezron became the father of Ram.

4.text: Ram became the father of Amminadab. Amminadab became the father of Nahshon. Nahshon became the father of Salmon.

5.text: Salmon became the father of Boaz by Rahab. Boaz became the father of Obed by Ruth. Obed became the father of Jesse.

6.text: Jesse became the father of King David. David became the father of Solomon by her who had been the wife of Uriah.

7.text: Solomon became the father of Rehoboam. Rehoboam became the father of Abijah. Abijah became the father of Asa.

8.text: Asa became the father of Jehoshaphat. Jehoshaphat became the father of Joram. Joram became the father of Uzziah.

9.text: Uzziah became the father of Jotham. Jotham became the father of Ahaz. Ahaz became the father of Hezekiah.

10.text: Hezekiah became the father of Manasseh. Manasseh became the father of Amon. Amon became the father of Josiah.

11.text: Josiah became the father of Jechoniah and his brothers, at the time of the exile to Babylon.

12.text: After the exile to Babylon, Jechoniah became the father of Shealtiel. Shealtiel became the father of Zerubbabel.

13.text: Zerubbabel became the father of Abiud. Abiud became the father of Eliakim. Eliakim became the father of Azor.

14.text: Azor became the father of Sadoc. Sadoc became the father of Achim. Achim became the father of Eliud.

15.text: Eliud became the father of Eleazar. Eleazar became the father of Matthan. Matthan became the father of Jacob.

16.text: Jacob became the father of Joseph, the husband of Mary, of whom was born Jesus who is called Christ.

17.text: And so, all the generations from Abraham to David are fourteen generations; from David to the exile to Babylon fourteen generations; and from the exile to Babylon until the Christ, fourteen generations.

18.text: Now the birth of Jesus Christ happened like this: after his mother, Mary, was promised in marriage to Joseph but before they came together, she was found pregnant by the Holy Spirit.

19.text: Joseph, her betrothed, who was a righteous man did not want to make her a public spectacle and so intended to put her away quietly.

20.text: But as he was thinking about these things, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream, saying, “Joseph, son of David, do not be afraid to take Mary your wife home, for what is conceived in her is by the Holy Spirit.

21.text: She will give birth to a son and you shall give him the name Jesus because he will be the one to save his people from their sins.”

22.text: Now all this happened so that what had been spoken by the Lord through the prophet might be fulfilled:

23.text: Behold, the virgin shall be with child and bring forth a son.   They shall call his name Emmanuel;   which means, ‘with us [is] God.’

24.text: Joseph arose from his sleep and did as the angel of the Lord had commanded him: he took his wife to [live with] him,

25.text: and had no relations with her before she had brought forth her firstborn son; and he named him Jesus.
